Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that only 6% of deaths were solely caused by Covid.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the CDC quietly updated the Covid numbers, suggesting a secretive or deliberate action, when in fact the CDC has been providing the same information since May.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the inclusion of comorbidities in Covid-related deaths, such as the fact that individuals with pre-existing health conditions may be more susceptible to severe illness or death from Covid.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the CDC has not drastically reduced the number of deaths attributable to Covid-19, as stated by the expert's verdict.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the CDC's information and presenting it in a misleading manner, leading to a distorted understanding of the actual data.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of Covid-19 by suggesting that only 6% of deaths are directly caused by the virus, when in reality Covid-19 can contribute to or exacerbate existing health conditions, leading to death.
